lead_paragraph: State lawmakers arrived Tuesday in the village, about 30 miles northeast of Albany, where the public water supply has been contaminated with high levels of a toxic chemical.

headline.print_headline: After Months of Anger in Upstate Village, Hearings on Tainted Water Begin
headline.main: After Months of Anger in Hoosick Falls, Hearings on Tainted Water Begin

snippet: State lawmakers arrived Tuesday in the village, about 30 miles northeast of Albany, where the public water supply has been contaminated with high levels of a toxic chemical....
abstract: State Senate committee begins hearings into water contamination in Hoosick Falls, NY, after months of resident complaints and frustration with local, state and federal response; town has become center of public health crisis after discovery that public water supply is tainted with high levels of perfluorooctanoic acid, or PFOA, chemical used in industrial products and production of Teflon.
